reviews.review: Perfect movie if all you want is mindless action scenes, peppered with some funny one-liners.
One of the best movies ever, can't wait for part 2!
This is what you get when your highest priority and investment is the story - record shattering awesomeness!
good film but spent to much time on build up and not much on the actual infinity war
Definitely time to quit while you're ahead Marvel

After starting this ride 10 years ago (or so) with Iron Man, being the comic book nerd that I am and knowing what Marvel was building up to, I'm extremely pleased with how it turned out. Even though I'm writing this after one viewing, I can't think of a single thing I didn't like about it. Thanos wasn't the flat world conqueror I was worried he'd be, in fact he was really the driving force of the film and can be considered your perfect model utilitarian. There's a one call back I absolutely loved (and kinda called years back). I loved how this movie was both intergalactic and Earth-bound. Finally, I very much enjoyed how it both incorporated elements of the Infinity Gauntlet, and took a major deviation from its plan in a way that makes me immensely interested in how the MCU unfolds from this point forward.
This Movie Delivers Nearly 3 Hours Of A Multiple Emotion Roller Coaster 100% Worth It

It is amazing how effectively this movie used a pantheon of Marvel super heroes and actors to tell such a coherent and well thought out tale.  The action and effects are fun to watch and the banter is great.  Which made the emotional impact of the dark ending all the more impactful.  Performances were great, and the background from the other movies allowed the story to really focus on Thanos and Gamorrah, resulting in one of the most interesting villains in comic book movie history.  Go into this buying into the Marvel mythology, and you will have great ride.
